member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implements the in such a way that the method executes the method for all children objects that also implement the interface.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.#ctor(PostSharp.Serialization.PortableFormatterConstructorContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.Advise(System.Object)
member.summary: Injects the advice into the child object.
member.returns: true if the children of have to be advised as well, false otherwise.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources
member.param: True to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.IsEligibleChild(System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Determines if an object is eligible to be a child of the target instance of the current aspect.
member.returns: true if is eligible to be a child without injecting any advice, otherwise false. When this method returns false, the aspect will the invoke the method.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.DisposableAttribute.ThrowObjectDisposedException
member.summary: Determines whether an should be thrown when an attempt is made to access an object that has already been disposed.

member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method, prevents the aspect to raise change notifications for this property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a type, implements the interface for this class and all children classes.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that stores strong references to the client delegates.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttribute.#ctor(PostSharp.Serialization.PortableFormatterConstructorContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies whether the event should hold a weak or strong reference to to the client delegates.
member.param: true if the event should hold a to the client delegates, false if the event should hold a normal reference.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttributeTargetClass
member.summary: Describes the members that are consumed by the aspect. You can define one or many of these members in classes that are the target of to customize the behavior of the aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttributeTargetClass.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttributeTargetClass.OnPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Raises the event. If this method is already present in the target code, the aspect will use it to raise the event. Otherwise, the aspect will introduce the method into the target class.
member.param: Name of the changed property. The aspect never passes null to this parameter.

member.name: E:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedAttributeTargetClass.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Event raised when a property has changed. This event is introduced by the aspect unless it is already present in the target class.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedOverflowException
member.summary: Exception thrown at runtime when the aspect encounters an excessively long chain is dependency. This situation is typically caused by a cyclic dependency.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedOverflowException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedOverflowException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new and sets the exception message.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedOverflowException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new and sets the exception message and the inner exception.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedServices
member.summary: Utility methods to work with the aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedServices.RaiseEventsImmediate(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises all events that are currently stored in the event buffer for the current thread and a given object.
member.param: The object for which events should be raised.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedServices.ResumeEvents
member.summary: Resumes the raising of events for the current thread after it has been suspending by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.NotifyPropertyChangedServices.SuspendEvents
member.summary: Suspends the raising of events for the current thread.
member.returns: true if events were suspended as a result of the current method call, false if events were already suspended before.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.PureAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, specifies that this method is a pure function, i.e. the method always returns the same result given the same parameter values. In the context of , it is also assumed that pure functions have only parameters of primitive types (, , ...). The parameter type is also accepted, but then it is assumed that instances passed are immutable (and changes to these objects will not be tracked).

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.PureAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.SafeForDependencyAnalysisAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a property, prevents the dependency analysis algorithm used by the aspect from emitting errors when it encounters constructs that it cannot analyze.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Model.SafeForDependencyAnalysisAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.param: true if the current object should be automatically attached to the default if it is not yet attached, otherwise false.
member.returns: true if the object is already attached to a or if is true, otherwise false.

member.summary: Defines callback methods that are invoked when a recordable object is involved in an undo or redo operation.

member.summary: Method invoked after the undo or redo operation has started.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.IRecordableCallback.OnReplaying(PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.ReplayKind,PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.ReplayContext)
member.summary: Method invoked before the undo or redo operation has started.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.MergeStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of possible return values for the method.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.MergeStatus.None
member.summary: The subsequent cannot be merged and is not commutative with the current .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.MergeStatus.Mergeable
member.summary: The subsequent can be merged into the current (for instance, two subsequent changes to the same field).

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.MergeStatus.Commutative
member.summary: The subsequent cannot be merged into the current , but both operations are commutative (for instance, two subsequent changes to different fields).

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.NotRecordedAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to field or property, specifies that it should not be affected by the aspect. Therefore, changes to this field or property will not be recorded into a , and will not be affected by undo/redo operations.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.NotRecordedAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation
member.summary: Base class for all operations. An operation is any change of state that can be appended to a and be therefore involved in an undo/redo operation.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation.GetMergeStatus(PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation)
member.summary: Determines how a given can be merged with the current .
member.param: The subsequent to be merged with the current one.
member.returns: A .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation.Merge(PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation)
member.summary: Merges a given into the current .
member.param: The to merge into the current one.

member.summary: Gets the operation name.

member.summary: Gets the , which is used by the to produce a human-readable description of the current operation.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.Operation.OperationKind
member.summary: Gets the kind of operation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specify the scope name.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.RecordingScopeOption
member.summary: Enumerates the kinds of recording scope.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.RecordingScopeOption.Default
member.summary: For declarative scopes, a is automatically opened for the first public method of a recordable object on the call stack.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.RecordingScopeOption.Skip
member.summary: Prevents a to be automatically opened for the target method. Cannot be used with .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Recording.RecordingScopeOption.Atomic
member.summary: Causes changes in the to be rolled back if the scope execution is not successful. In case of declarative scope (), it means that changes done by the method will be rolled back if the method results in an exception. For imperative scopes (, the changes will be rolled back if the scope is disposed by the method without previous call to the method. Unlike normal scopes, atomic scopes are nested. However, only the top scope can be seen in the and collections.
